dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Zacks Market Edge Highlights: Red Cat, Barrick Gold, Arista Networks, Nio and Apple
News Content: For Immediate Release

Chicago, IL – January 27, 2025 – Zacks Market Edge is a podcast hosted weekly by Zacks Stock Strategist Tracey Ryniec. Every week, Tracey will be joined by guests to discuss the hottest investing topics in stocks, bonds and ETFs and how it impacts your life. To listen to the podcast, click here:  https://www.zacks.com/stock/news/2403156/questions-and-answers-on-your-5-favorite-stocks

Questions and Answers on Your 5 Favorite Stocks

Welcome to Episode #431 of the Zacks Market Edge Podcast.

(0:30) - Breaking Down The Stock Picks Investors Want To Know About (3:55) - Top Picks To Keep On Your Watchlist Right Now (31:40) - Episode Roundup: RCAT, GOLD, ANET, NIO, AAPL Podcast@Zacks.com

Every week, host and Zacks stock strategist, Tracey Ryniec, will be joined by guests to discuss the hottest investing topics in stocks, bonds, and ETFs and how it impacts your life.

This week, Tracey is going solo to answer some of the questions left for her in the YouTube comments to prior podcasts. These were questions mostly about individual stock. She aims to please on talking about some of your favorite stocks.

This week's list includes stocks from various industries and it even includes some small caps as well as one Magnificent 7 stock.

Tracey looked at the Price, Consensus and Earnings Surprise chart for each, as well as the earnings estimate data.

A Look at 5 of Your Favorite Stocks

1. Red Cat Holdings, Inc. RCAT

Red Cat Holdings is a small cap company with a market cap of $701 million which makes drone technology for military, government, and commercial operations.

Shares of Red Cat Holdings are down 41% year-to-date, but the shares have soared 1003% over the last year. It's a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell) but Zacks only has one earnings estimate.

Should you take a chance on Red Cat Holdings?

2. Barrick Gold Corp. GOLD

Barrick Gold is a large cap global gold miner. Tracey talked about the gold trade, specifically with the miners, in a 2024 podcast because the price of gold was hitting new highs.

Shares of Barrick Gold are up 2.3% year-to-date but have only gained 1.5% over the last year. It's cheap, with a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 9.7. 2025 earnings are expected to rise 30.3%.

Barrick Gold is a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) stock.

Should a gold miner, like Barrick Gold, be on your short list?

3. Arista Networks Inc. ANET

Arista Networks is a leader in data-driven, cloud-to-client networking for large AI, data center, campus, and routing environments. It has a market cap of $163 billion.

Shares of Arista Networks have soared over the last year, rising 93.7%. In 2025, they're up another 15.9% to new all-time highs. Arista Networks isn't cheap. It trades with a forward P/E of 53.6. Sales and earnings are expected to rise by the double digits again in 2025.

Story Continues

Arista Networks is a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) stock. It reports earnings on Feb 18, 2025.

Should an AI play like Arista Networks be on your watch list?

4. Nio Inc. NIO

Nio is a Chinese global smart vehicle manufacturer. It has a market cap of $7.3 billion.

Shares of Nio are down 5.7% year-to-date and have fallen 30.9% over the last year. Nio doesn't have a P/E ratio because it's earnings are still negative. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for 2025 is calling for a loss of $1.01.

Nio is a Zacks #3 (Hold) stock.

With shares trading near 5-year lows, should a smart car manufacturer like Nio be on your watch list?

5. Apple Inc. AAPL

Apple is a Magnificent 7 stock and is one of the four pillars of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway empire. But shares of Apple have declined 11.3% year-to-date and are now "only" up 15.4% over the last year.

But even though the shares have weakened, Apple is not cheap. It still trades with a forward P/E ratio of 30.1. A P/E ratio under 15 is considered a value.

Apple also has a Zacks Rank of a 4, or Sell.

If Apple falls further, would it be a buying opportunity?

What Else Do You Need to Know About These 5 Favorite Stocks?

Tune into this week's podcast to find out.

Why Haven't You Looked at Zacks' Top Stocks?

Since 2000, our top stock-picking strategies have blown away the S&P's +7.0 average gain per year. Amazingly, they soared with average gains of +44.9%, +48.4% and +55.2% per year.

Today you can access their live picks without cost or obligation.

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news highlights various stocks, including Apple Inc., which has seen a recent decline of 11.3% year-to-date and is rated as a 'Sell' by Zacks. Although Apple is a strong player in the market, it trades at a high forward P/E ratio of 30.1, suggesting it's not undervalued at this time. Additionally, the podcast does not provide positive catalysts for Apple's immediate price movement, leading to a moderate expectation of further declines or stagnation. Thus, the probabilities reflect a higher likelihood of the stock experiencing further downward pressure rather than a significant upward movement.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article is a summary of a Zacks Market Edge podcast episode discussing five stocks, including Apple (AAPL). While Apple is mentioned alongside other companies, the article highlights some negative signals like a year-to-date decline of 11.3% and a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell). It also mentions the high forward P/E ratio, indicating it might not be a value stock despite the recent dip. This mixed sentiment, leaning slightly negative, suggests a higher probability of a price fall than a rise in the immediate short term following the release of this news. This is due to the negative Zacks ranking.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The Zacks Market Edge podcast mentions Apple (AAPL) as one of five stocks discussed, noting its recent decline (-11.3% year-to-date), a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell), and a high forward P/E ratio of 30.1. While the podcast doesn't offer a specific prediction, the Zacks Rank and P/E ratio suggest a negative outlook. However, the mention in the podcast could bring some attention to the stock, potentially leading to a slight price increase related to increased trading volume. The overall tone is neutral to slightly negative, considering Apple's current valuation and Zacks rating. The probability of a price increase is lower due to these factors.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news content provides a mixed outlook for Apple Inc. (AAPL). On one hand, Apple is described as a 'Magnificent 7' stock and a key holding in Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway, which could instill confidence. On the other hand, the stock has declined 11.3% year-to-date, trades at a high forward P/E ratio of 30.1 (considered expensive), and has a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell). The high P/E ratio and Sell rating suggest potential overvaluation and downward pressure. However, the long-term reputation and brand strength of Apple might mitigate some negative sentiment. Given these factors, the probability of a fall is slightly higher than a rise in the short term.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news headline and content do not provide any directly positive or negative information specific to Apple Inc. (AAPL) that would significantly impact its stock price. The mention of Apple is part of a broader discussion about five favorite stocks, including Red Cat Holdings, Barrick Gold, Arista Networks, Nio, and Apple. For Apple, it's noted that the shares have declined 11.3% year-to-date and have a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell), with a forward P/E ratio of 30.1. The information provided does not offer any new or surprising insights that would drastically change investor perceptions. Therefore, based on this news, the probabilities of the stock price rising or falling are relatively neutral, but slightly leaning towards a higher chance of the stock price falling due to the existing negative trends and rankings mentioned.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news article discusses five favorite stocks, including Apple Inc. (AAPL), and provides an analysis of each company's current stock performance and future prospects. For Apple Inc., the article mentions that the shares have declined 11.3% year-to-date and are now only up 15.4% over the last year, with a forward P/E ratio of 30.1 and a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell). This suggests that the stock may not be a strong buying opportunity at the moment, but if it falls further, it could be considered.

Despite these points, the article does not provide specific positive catalysts or reasons for a stock price rise in the near term. Therefore, the probability of a stock price rise appears lower.

The cumulative outlook appears to lean towards further downward pressure on the stock rather than significant upward movement, supported by the negative sentiment expressed in the podcast's context. Therefore, the probabilities reflect a higher likelihood of a decrease in stock price in the near term.
